page.title: 10ABBEYFORD WOOD
page.content: {Abbeyford Wood}is a wood in Brightley. It is owned by the{Forestry Commission and the local people use it for picnics,walking and picking blackberries. In Abbeyford Wood the trees you get there are scots pine,norway spruce, ash even holly and hazel. The trees are mostly evergreen but some are deciduous. Some times the trees are cut down for christmas trees. There was a {wildlife park about ten years ago and some of the porcupines and deer escaped into the forest. After that people have seen them in the wood.People are not allow- ed to ride bikes in the wood because it would encourage people to ride their motorbikes in there and that would spoil the forest.
